title: 'Land Mafias Wanted To Sell My Sisters': In Murder Video, UP Man Reveals Why He Killed Family - News18
summary:
Chilling Murder-Suicide: UP Man Kills Family, Blames Land Mafia and Neighbors

Date & Source: Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 20:11 IST

In a shocking turn of events, a 24-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh named Arshad murdered his mother and four sisters before sharing a video of the crime online. Arshad was later arrested at the crime scene in Lucknow.

The chilling video, which emerged hours after the murders, shows Arshad alleging that neighbors and land mafia in their hometown of Budaun had captured their house and planned to traffic his sisters. He claimed that he killed his family members to prevent this from happening.

  1. Arshad choked and slit the wrists of his mother and sisters.
  2. He blamed local land mafia and neighbors for harassing his family and capturing their house.
  3. Arshad requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for justice.

"I have killed my mother and sisters. When police get this video, they must know that the locals are responsible. They harassed us to capture our house. We raised our voice, but no one heard. It has been 15 days that we have been sleeping on the footpath, wandering in the cold. We don’t want the children to wander in the cold. They have captured our house. The documents are with us."
- Arshad

Arshad also claimed that his family wanted to live peacefully and had approached many people for help, but no one assisted them. He expressed fear that his sisters were dying and that he himself would not live much longer.
newTitle: Chilling Murder-Suicide: UP Man Kills Family, Blames Land Mafia and Neighbors

title: Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In 2025, the Supreme Court of India will operate under three Chief Justices and will see the retirement of seven judges.

The Chief Justice of India (CJI), Justice Sanjiv Khanna, will step down on May 13, 2025, followed by Justice BR Gavai and Justice Surya Kant assuming future leadership positions.

  • Justice CT Ravikumar retires on January 5.
  • Justice Hrishikesh Roy retires on January 31.
  • CJI Sanjiv Khanna retires on May 13.
  • Justice Abhay Sreeniwas Oka retires on May 24.
  • Justice Bela Trivedi retires on June 9.
  • Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia retires on August 9.
  • Justice BR Gavai retires on November 23.
“The Supreme Court will witness significant changes with multiple retirements and a transition in leadership.”

This upcoming succession in the Supreme Court is crucial for understanding the future judicial landscape.
newTitle: Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025

title: Girl, 3, Rescued 10 Days After Falling Into 700-Foot Borewell In Rajasthan - NDTV
summary:
Miraculous Rescue: 3-Year-Old Girl Saved After 10 Days in 700-Foot Borewell

Date: December 23, 2022 | Source: NDTV

In a remarkable rescue operation, a three-year-old girl named Chetna was successfully pulled out from a 700-feet deep borewell in Rajasthan's Kotputli, 10 days after she had fallen in. Chetna was immediately hospitalized, and her condition is stable but being closely monitored.

  1. Chetna fell into the borewell on December 23 while playing.
  2. Disaster Relief Forces and a medical team were immediately deployed to rescue her.
  3. Initial attempts to pull her up failed, and a tunnel was dug in the wrong direction.
  4. After several failed efforts and with Chetna's condition deteriorating, she was finally rescued.

"Her condition will continue to be monitored," said hospital authorities.

This grueling rescue mission has been a test of human endurance and a tale of hope amidst despair.
newTitle: Miraculous Rescue: 3-Year-Old Girl Saved After 10 Days in 700-Foot Borewell

Big win for Modi government, trouble for Pakistan as extradition of 26/11 Mumbai attacks accused Tahawwur Ran - India.com
summary:
Significant Extradition Approval for 26/11 Mumbai Attacks Accused Tahawwur Rana

Publication Date: Recent

Source: India.com

In a significant win for Indian diplomatic efforts, Pakistani-Canadian Tahawwur Rana may soon be extradited to India for his alleged role in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, which resulted in around 175 fatalities. His extradition has gained momentum following a federal appeals court ruling in the United States.

Key Points

  • Tahawwur Rana is implicated in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.
  • His extradition was approved by the California-based Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals.
  • Charges against Rana include conspiracy, waging war, murder, and terrorism.
  • Rana had been previously sentenced to 14 years in a separate case.
  • He was released on compassionate grounds during the Covid pandemic.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The judgement mentioned Rana helping Headley get a five-year visa for India under the pretext of setting up a branch of his business there.

Rana’s extradition represents a step toward holding individuals accountable for their actions connected to the attacks.
newTitle: Significant Extradition Approval for 26/11 Mumbai Attacks Accused Tahawwur Rana

BJP planning to demolish worship places in Delhi: CM Atishi - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Planning Demolition of Worship Places in Delhi, Claims CM Atishi

Publication Date: January 01, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi accused the BJP of planning to demolish Hindu temples and a Buddhist worship place in the city, while promising support to religious leaders.

  • The Chief Minister claimed that a 'Religious Committee' ordered the demolition of six religious structures.
  • The BJP and Lieutenant Governor's office denied the allegations, stating no such orders were issued.
  • Atishi presented minutes of the meeting from the Religious Committee as evidence.
  • The affected locations include West Patel Nagar, Dilshad Garden, Sunder Nagri, Seema Puri, Gokal Puri, and New Usmanpur.
“The two-faced BJP has been exposed. On one hand, they claim to be defenders of the Hindus and on the other hand, they surreptitiously plan for demolition of temples.” - CM Atishi

The article outlines the growing tensions between the Delhi government and the BJP regarding the management of religious sites and raises concerns about potential political motivations behind the demolition plans.
newTitle: BJP Planning Demolition of Worship Places in Delhi, Claims CM Atishi

Delhi cafe owner dies ‘by suicide’ amid divorce dispute with wife, his family alleges harassment by in-laws - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi Cafe Owner Dies by Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Alleges In-Law Harassment

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

A 40-year-old businessman, Puneet Khurana, was found dead in his home in Delhi's Model Town in a suspected suicide linked to his ongoing divorce negotiations with his wife.

  • Puneet Khurana co-owned Woodbox Cafe with his wife, Manisha Jagdish Pawa.
  • His family alleges harassment by in-laws during divorce proceedings.
  • The police found his body following a call from his uncle.
  • A post-mortem is scheduled to determine the cause of death.
  • This incident follows another recent suicide case of a techie in Bengaluru.
“The family of the deceased made allegations of harassment against the deceased’s wife and in-laws.”

The tragic death raises serious concerns about the impact of familial disputes on mental health, especially in divorce situations.
newTitle: Delhi Cafe Owner Dies by Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Alleges In-Law Harassment

title: Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC): Important Judgments By Supreme Court In 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC): Important Judgments By Supreme Court In 2024

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Live Law

As 2025 begins, Live Law summarizes important decisions on the Code of Criminal Procedure of the past year. Here are the key highlights:

  • Witness Statement Recorded In Absence Of Accused Can Be Used As Evidence If Conditions In S.299 CrPC Are Fulfilled : Supreme Court - The Court held that statements of prosecution witnesses recorded in the absence of the accused can be used as evidence if the accused was absconding.
  • Police Must Exercise Heightened Caution When Drawn Into Dispute Involving Unethical Transactions : Supreme Court - Police should ensure that criminal law remedies aren't misused over civil claims.
  • Case Of Accused Under S.313 CrPC Not Suggested To Victim In Cross-Examination; Supreme Court Refuses To Set Aside Conviction In Rape Case - The conviction cannot be set aside if the accused's statement regarding consent is not put forth during cross-examination.
  • High Court Must Not Hesitate In Quashing Criminal Proceedings Which Are Essentially Of Civil Nature - The High Court should quash criminal prosecutions arising from civil transactions.

...

Each decision contributes to the evolving interpretation and application of the CrPC in India, with implications for legal practitioners and the justice system.
newTitle: Key Supreme Court Judgments on CrPC in 2024

Watch Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition As Trains Honk In Synchrony - News18
summary:
Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition: Trains Honk in Synchrony

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, News18

The iconic Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CST) station in Mumbai echoed with a symphony of train horns as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve, marking a unique tradition that has become synonymous with the station.

  • The tradition involves rail car sheds and locomotives simultaneously honking at midnight on New Year's Eve.
  • Commuters captured and shared the event on social media, with some users expressing surprise at the tradition while others noted its commonality.
  • Railway enthusiasts are credited with coordinating this event for several years, turning it into an eagerly awaited spectacle.
  • The atmosphere at the station on New Year's Eve is charged with joy and camaraderie, bringing people from all walks of life together to celebrate the railway heritage.
newTitle: Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition: Trains Honk in Synchrony

Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him' - News18
summary:
Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him'

Date & Source: January 01, 2025, 19:50 IST - News18

Puneet Khurana, owner of For God’s Cake bakery, allegedly died by suicide amid an ongoing divorce dispute with his wife. He was found hanging in his house in Model Town’s Kalyan Vihar area. His family claimed that Puneet was "upset with his wife" and had been facing mental torture and harassment from her and her family.

Key Points:

  1. The couple got married in 2016 and co-owned the bakery and another eatery called Woodbox Cafe.
  2. Puneet's last conversation was with his wife, discussing their bakery business. His family claims the wife recorded the conversation and sent it to her relatives.
  3. Puneet's sister accused his wife and her family of mental torture and harassment, with a 59-minute video recording as evidence.
  4. The case comes weeks after a similar incident involving a Bengaluru-based techie.

Notable Quote:

"You are calling me at 3 am, can’t you sleep? You disrespected me and my family." - Puneet Khurana's wife, as per India Today

Conclusion: The incident has once again highlighted the issue of mental harassment and torture within marriages, with calls for stricter laws and better support systems for victims.
newTitle: Delhi Bakery Owner's Suicide Linked to Divorce Dispute and Alleged Harassment

  • A woman in Noida tried to kill her friend.

title: Lucknow: Agra man shoots chilling video after killing mother, 4 sisters at hotel, explains reason behind murders - Hindustan Times
summary:
Lucknow Tragedy: Man Kills Mother and Four Sisters, Claims to Protect Family

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, Hindustan Times

Lucknow woke up to a horrifying incident where a 24-year-old man, Arshad, allegedly murdered his mother and four sisters at a hotel, claiming he acted to "protect" his family from neighbors who planned to sell his sisters in Hyderabad.

  1. The family, originally from Agra, had been staying at the hotel since December 30 to celebrate New Year.
  2. Arshad served his family food and alcohol laced with intoxicants before killing them.
  3. Arshad recorded a video after the crime, explaining his actions and showing the bodies.
  4. Police have detained Arshad, and his father remains at large.

"Our neighbours were trying to take over our property and planned to sell my sisters in Hyderabad. I couldn’t let that happen," Arshad purportedly said in the video.

Police are reviewing CCTV camera footage to trace Arshad’s father and bring him to justice.
newTitle: Lucknow Tragedy: Man Kills Mother and Four Sisters, Claims to Protect Family

title: Bengaluru suicide case: HC tells techie's dad to inform SC about daughter-in-law's custody - The Federal
summary:
Bengaluru suicide case: HC tells techie's dad to inform SC about daughter-in-law's custody

Date: January 1, 2023

Source: PTI

The Karnataka High Court has instructed the father of Atul Subhash, a techie who committed suicide, to notify the Supreme Court regarding the judicial custody status of Nikita, his estranged wife and the accused.

  • The Supreme Court is reviewing a petition by Atul's mother seeking custody of her minor grandson.
  • Justice Hemant Chandangoudar issued the interim order following a challenge by Nikita against her arrest.
  • Nikita's legal counsel argued her arrest was illegal, citing improper grounds for detention.
  • The State Public Prosecutor requested additional time to compile investigation details.
  • The High Court agreed to expedite consideration of Nikita's bail plea, scheduled for January 4.
Nikita’s lawyer highlighted the unlawful nature of her arrest, emphasizing her imperative to defend herself.

The situation surrounding the case highlights critical legal questions and the ongoing family dispute over the custody of the child.
newTitle: High Court Directs Techie's Father on Daughter-in-Law's Custody Amid Ongoing Case

title: Bharat Ratna Demand For Manmohan Singh Gains Momentum After Telangana Assembly Resolution - News18
summary:
Demand for Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh Grows After Telangana Assembly Resolution

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: News18

The Telangana Assembly has urged the Central government to confer the Bharat Ratna on former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, prompting many in Congress to support the initiative. Congress leaders are calling for the highest civilian award to honor his significant contributions.

  • Telangana Assembly passes a resolution demanding Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh.
  • Congress Deputy Leader in the Rajya Sabha, Pramod Tiwari, emphasizes the need to acknowledge Singh's leadership.
  • Subharansh Kumar Rai mentions Singh's advocacy for key legislation such as the Right to Education and Right to Information.
  • BJP criticizes Congress for not acting on a previous recommendation to award Singh the Bharat Ratna.
  • Manmohan Singh recently passed away at the age of 92.
“I urge the Centre to accept the resolution. Manmohanji was a great leader of our country and he should be awarded the Bharat Ratna.” - Pramod Tiwari

The push for the Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh highlights his acknowledged role in shaping modern India, suggesting a broader recognition of his legacy may be underway.
newTitle: Demand for Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh Grows After Telangana Assembly Resolution
